comment._content: Yes, I am positive it is A.A. Milne. I just googled images of him.

comment.author: 63372903@N05
comment._content: Wow! So cool! All of the pictures are amazing!

comment.author: 23150419@N07
comment._content: I think the bear is too small to be Winnie. Check out the pics of Harry Colebourn and Winnie. A. A. Milne did not meet the bear until after Harry left it at the London Zoo. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winnipeg_the_Bear

comment.author: 61232251@N05
comment._content: We don't think it's Milne but are looking to find out if it is Harry Colebourn and the bear. The time period is right, so that's a start.

comment.author: 49503013663@N01
comment._content: Wouldn't that just be fabulous if it was Harry and the bear cub.

comment.author: 25919078@N05
comment._content: It may be a photo taken in London, or maybe Montreal or Toronto. If you look at the architecture of the building in the background, and the broad stone/concrete pavement between the photographer and the building, there's nothing like that in Halifax. It would have to be a bigger centre. Colebourn bought the bear in Ontario in 1914, and if this is that bear, the photo would have to have been taken very soon after that. Photos of Colebourn and his bear taken later in 1914, in England, already show a substantially larger bear.
